newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Major Slovak stocks steady, SAX slightly higher.
newsitem.headline: Major Slovak stocks steady, SAX slightly higher.

text.p: Slovak blue chips held steady in moderate trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) on Tuesday, with gains to shares of drug maker Slovakofarma pushing the SAX index up 0.49 points to 206.64.
Slovakofarma rose 50 to 5,100 crowns, but brokers said volumes were small making it necessary to wait until a larger parcel of shares was available to show any longer-term trend.
"There is stable demand for Slovakofarma shares, but there seems to be a lack of liquidity at the moment," said Libor Briska of Creditanstalt.
Briska said investors were generally very quiet at present, but noted there is still interest in the blue chips, "so the market is more likely to slightly rise rather than decline in the mid-term."

Overall volume rose to 1,975,782 share - due mainly to 1,956,672 changing hands in direct trades - from 546,514 shares on Monday. Turnover increased to 1.09 billion crowns, from 383.55 million on Monday.
